channel.title: Deciding on getting a 2010 mustang. (snowy roads)
channel.description:
Well i have the money for it and it's been my dream since i was 11 to get a ford mustang, although the downside is i live in michigan where in the winters the roads are icy :( and from doing some research online i found that the ford mustang isn't very snow capable.
Is there any snow-worthy sports cars you guys could suggest? or how would i match up on the snowy roads with my mustang?

item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Mr Mopar X:

A Mitsubishi Evo would be a great choice for snowy roads.

Bit much on torque for those, I’ve seen 3 in the ditch in Michigan before I left. Not saying they are a bad one for snow, since they are AWD it should be fine.

@OP - The Ford Mustang will not handle the snow very well at all. They have too much HP and torque and will spin the tires without even trying. When I left on the 6th to Mississippi (warm here btw :P), I had a front-wheel drive car and it spun alot. This year is a very icy year for Michigan. If you are wanting a sport car for snow I would suggest anything AWD, FWD, or even something with true-4. My personal fav is the Dodge Neon SRT4, but those will spin tires alot. Basically, don’t go RWD sports car unless you want to park it for the winter months.

Be sure to give whatever you buy a car wash weekly though, bunch of salt around

item.description:

[quote=“Cowie`, post:34, topic:377181”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=473091.msg3461072#msg3461072 date=1294484001]
Front wheel drive is better in the snow/ice than rear wheel drive, hands down. Obviously 4 wheel drive would be better than either. Which is why I recommended the AWD Charger R/T (which has very close to the same performance as the awesome SRT-8, maybe even better acceleration due to the improved traction?). A rear-wheel-drive car or truck in the winter is a nightmare, trust me as I’ve driven my share of them.
[/quote]

Your idea of a nightmare is my idea of having fucking fun.

p.s fuck the snowy roads and just get an elise[/quote]

I know what you mean, and doing a few donuts and such is fun. It becomes a nightmare in quite a few situations though, I recall a time I was stuck on the downside of an ice-covered hill, and my 2wd truck had turned sideways, blocking the entire road, and my wheels would spin with no traction going forward or backward. If ANYTHING came over the top of the hill, I’d be dead right now. I ended up punching the gas and it turned around enough so I could put it in neutral and roll back down the road about a mile, then I took a running start at the hill and barely made it over the top. Almost dying is not fun at all.

[quote=“Explisionist, post:30, topic:377181”]Why would you say RWD is bad? Trucks= RWD they go fine with snow, 2W or 4W. Almost every police car is RWD or AWD and in Missouri we use Crown Vics or we Impala’s… And they both are great in the snow, they have better control during the snow then FWD since your power is in the front your obviously gonna slide or wreck and lose control over it. So IMO get a RWD vehicle or a AWD don’t go with a shit FWD.

Like MITB said get a charger.[/quote]I’m going to reply to this before I read the other new comments. You are a fucking idiot. Please allow me to list the reasons why in a point form order so as to save space and prevent finger-cramping.

[ul][li]A 2-wheel drive truck will not go anywhere in snow. An AWD will but that defeats your argument?[/li]
[li]You mention how police interceptors are RWD or AWD. Correct, usually, but anywhere with snowy conditions above a certain limit requires the vehicles to receive the full police interceptor upgrade including new stiffer suspension, a supercharged engine and hey…an AWD package! You will never see a RWD interceptor in any town with a real winter.[/li]
[li]This point could be long based on your retarded theory that FWD = slide + wreck due to loss of control. When in fact FWD gives you MORE control than a RWD since your power is in the front…THE SAME PLACE YOU’RE PIVOTING ON.[/li]
[li]The main reason RWD vehicles are used in sports like NASCAR is because a FWD setup eliminates most of the room that could be used for a transaxle. Some drivers have requested a vehicle to be built to spec of a FWD for more control at high speeds (a rumor that RWD has).[/li]
[li]Not really a point at all…more just pointing out your ignorance…but the impala has been front wheel drive for years and Ford has said they have no intentions of returning it to RWD in the future.[/li][/ul]

God damn I hate retards. Don’t respond. You lost.
